channel.title: How you get npcs to drop?
channel.description: yup call me a noob but i never bothered finding uot..so any1 knnow that could tell me please?[br][size=1]Posted at: October 16, 2006, 11:10:49 PM[/size][hr]ye dont be just looking at it if u no how please say....[br][size=1]Posted at: October 16, 2006, 11:14:21 PM[/size][hr]comon.........[br][size=1]Posted at: October 16, 2006, 11:21:25 PM[/size][hr]f[br][size=1]Posted at: October 16, 2006, 11:51:53 PM[/size][hr].[br][size=1]Posted at: October 17, 2006, 12:10:11 AM[/size][hr].[br][size=1]Posted at: October 17, 2006, 12:20:19 AM[/size][hr].

item.title: How you get npcs to drop?
item.dc:creator: @jonyo jonyo
item.description:
@jonyo wrote:

hope this helps dude

open up npchandler.java.

Search for this.

randomKBD()

It will come up with this

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

under the very last } press enter and paste in this code.

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == NPCIDHERE) { ItemHandler.addItem(DROPIDHERE, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

ok take out NPCIDHERE and type in the id number of the npc that will drop the item. Then take out the DROPIDHERE and put in the id number of the item not the amount dropped only the id number.

ok hope that helps… but also try not to flame other people when they ask questions because it makes you feel stupid and kind of invites people to flame you back just a warning

Read full topic
